unnormalised: Okay, here's your informal news snippet:
normalised: automotive: Delhi traffic gets a makeover!
Oyee Delhiites! Get ready for some changes on the roads. Seems Doctor Verma from the Transport Ministry has been burning the midnight oil, tweaking traffic regulations to ease the chaos.

unnormalised: Oyee Delhiites! Get ready for some changes on the roads. Seems Dr. Verma from the Transport Ministry has been burning the midnight oil, tweaking traffic regulations to ease the chaos.
normalised: First off, stricter enforcement of lane discipline near A I I M S is coming, complete with hefty fines (think rupee five thousand!). Autorickshaw drivers, be warned!

unnormalised: First off, stricter enforcement of lane discipline near AIIMS is coming, complete with hefty fines (think Rs. 5000!). Autorickshaw drivers, be warned!
normalised: Heavier vehicles are now banned on Ring Road during peak hours (eight A M to eleven A M and five P M to eight P M). Expect diversions, folks.

unnormalised: Heavier vehicles are now banned on Ring Road during peak hours (8 AM - 11 AM and 5 PM - 8 PM). Expect diversions, folks.
normalised: Parking woes near Connaught Place might get a little better. They are testing out new automated parking systems covering two thousand square feet near Palika Bazaar.

unnormalised: Parking woes near Connaught Place might get a little better. Theyâ€™re testing out new automated parking systems covering 2000 sq ft near Palika Bazaar.
normalised: Also, all vehicles need to have high-security registration plates (H S R P) now, no excuses!

unnormalised: Also, all vehicles need to have high-security registration plates (HSRP) now, no excuses!
normalised: They are even thinking of implementing odd-even again around Diwali time.

unnormalised: They are even thinking of implementing odd-even AGAIN around Diwali time.
normalised: These new rules are expected to reduce congestion by fifteen percent and improve air quality. Fingers crossed! Let us hope these changes finally make driving in Delhi a little less stressful, eh?

unnormalised: These new rules are expected to reduce congestion by 15% and improve air quality. Fingers crossed! Let's hope these changes finally make driving in Delhi a little less stressful, eh?
